subject: Investing
title: Rebalancing: Staying on Target
description: A quick win: understand Rebalancing: Staying on Target.

hook.text: An investor set a 60/40 stock-bond split. Three years later it drifted to 80/20 with no action taken.

buildup.text: Rebalancing means selling winners and buying losers to restore your original allocation.

discovery.text: Without rebalancing, your portfolio drifts toward whatever's been risingâ€”and takes on extra risk.

twist.text: It feels wrong to sell what's winning. But rebalancing forces 'buy low, sell high' automatically.

climax.text: Annual or threshold-based rebalancing (when drift exceeds 5%) captures gains and controls risk.

punchline.text: Rebalancing is discipline disguised as a portfolio adjustment.

quiz.question: What does rebalancing a portfolio involve?
